description: This seminar is designed to investigate the relationships between children's cognitive development and their use of media (i.e., television, computers, the Internet, video games, electronic toys). We will examine normal patterns of children's thinking and how these patterns are situated in children's lives (e.g., contextual factors that mediate cognitive functioning). Then, students will apply these concepts to understand both the creation of and the effects associated with media.
name: Children and Media: Cognitive Development

values.comments: Students enjoyed the course, but many left suggestions for the professor.  Some students felt the final project was too technical and production-oriented and that more time was needed to complete it.  Other students felt the 3-hour lectures dragged on and could have used more dynamic teaching methods to keep students alert.  Overall, however, students expressed praise for Prof. Linebarger.
